title: Ticket #4674: Allow sub-collector queries
description:
When working with a collector tree (esp. in the glideinWMS case), we often don't forward Master classads from parent to child due to the lack of memory.

If you want to "condor_off" a glidein, you have to write a for-loop to iterate across all the child collectors, find the master ad, and then issue the condor_off.

I propose we extend the CollectorList class to first query the pool collector for known child collectors, then issue the query to each returned child collector (in order).

The child collectors selected will be controlled by COLLECTOR_QUERY_EXPR; if set to false (default), the parent collector is queried directly. If, for example, this is set to "true", all child collectors and the parent are queried; the parent is queried because it advertises itself.

Similarly to how "condor_q -g" works, I propose the following error semantics: if there's at least one child collector that returns successfully, the whole operation is marked as a success. Otherwise, the operation fails.
